channel.title: Static IP showing after going through Whonix
channel.description: My current Whonix is behind a static IP. For some reason, on a https forum, it showed up as part of the tracking and I can see it on that site. How can I change this in the gateway or settings where that address off the TOR browser never comes up to anyone.

item.title: Static IP showing after going through Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
See also:

Whonix

DoNot

Non-technical steps for staying anonymous

Read full topic
item.source: Static IP showing after going through Whonix

item.title: Static IP showing after going through Whonix
item.dc:creator: janesmith
item.description:
And you are SPOT ON! Damn, I logged into that site with a different browser when I found it outside of TOR. Yeap, user error in the extreme. Thank you Patrick!

Read full topic
item.source: Static IP showing after going through Whonix

item.title: Static IP showing after going through Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Did you login in that forum before at any time without using Tor / Whonix? If so, the website (forum) might have logged it and show it as part of a login history. Some websites provide such a login history showing your historic IP addresses for security purposes. In that case, there is nothing Whonix or Tor can do about this. Don’t ever reuse any account you have previously used without Tor / Whonix.

Did you run a Tor relay / exit server?

Read full topic
item.source: Static IP showing after going through Whonix
